headline: Would you pull over and stop for a robot cop?

utterances.speaker: JAMES COMEY, FORMER FBI DIRECTOR
utterances.sentences: Not that I know of. I don't know of anything like that. I don't know. I don't know, that's a harder question. I don't know exactly what he means by that. I don't know the answer to that. I don't know. I don't know, in hindsight, whether that was the right call or not. I don't know whether it's true or not. It's a crazy thing to have to say. I don't know whether I would say it's a mistake. I don't know. I don't know what the right answer is. I don't. I can speculate, but I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't think he knows anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, Stormy Daniels is now doing comedy, which is a step up from doing porn. Unless you're Seth Meyers. Anyone who sits through his act always feel screwed. Here's part of it.

utterances.speaker: SETH MEYERS, TALK SHOW HOST
utterances.sentences: I want to ask about Ilhan Omar. You keep bringing up the two tweets that she has apologized for and I think that's a little unfair to her, especially because we've established --

utterances.speaker: MEGHAN MCCAIN, COHOST, THE VIEW
utterances.sentences: Are you her publicist?

utterances.speaker: MEYERS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: MCCAIN
utterances.sentences: Are you her press person?

utterances.speaker: MEYERS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm just someone who cares about the fact that there's someone out there who is in a minority, who has had death threats against her and I think that we should all use the same language that you're asking her to be careful about her language, and I would ask everybody else to be careful about theirs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a comedian. Stormy, Stormy, if that's your competition, you've got nothing to worry about. Comedians, it's the only thing Trump didn't make great again. Instead, they're now shrill little hall monitors with tiny wrists. Stormy though, now since Trump wasn't as bad as her ex-lawyer, Michael Avenatti. Now, when you regret hiring your lawyer more than doing porn, that's a bad lawyer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: One who faces centuries in jail. So now Storm is doing stand up to earn a paycheck. But at least she's standing up to earn a paycheck.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you. In other news. "The New York Times" had a big scoop. Trump lost a bundle in the 90s. I know, it's amazing. Also, that movie "Home Alone" looks like a hit. And how about that Vanilla Ice guy? Mark my words that fella is going places. But I guess when you can't find any news to match your delusions, you'll make anything else news, including what Trump actually talked about 15 years ago.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: About 13 years ago, I was seriously in trouble. I was billions of dollars in debt. But I fought back and I won big league.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good job, "Times," you really dropped the bombshell -- a bombshell revealed to millions of people on national TV over a decade and a half ago. What other bombshells will "The Times" glean from reality TV? That Kim Kardashian once wore leggings? That one of the real housewives threw a glass of Merlot at another real housewife? That someone on "Survivor" ate a bug?  So is it journalism when someone gives you someone else's tax returns? It's odd. No one in the media minds how "The Times" got them. But under Trump, real news is skipped for the old news. Because when the real news is good, the media has got to find conflict in the past to make their present bearable.   If only there were a drug.

utterances.speaker: TOM SHILLUE, FOX NATION HOST
utterances.sentences: So Trump lost a bunch of money in the 80s. How is that news? I mean, I'm so tired of "The New York Times" packaging old news like it is new. What are you going to tell me next? Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait? The Berlin Wall came down? How about Milli Vanilli was actually lip synching? The media thinks we're idiots.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You should talk to your doctor, you may be suffering from common sense.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Common sense is when you recognize old news for what it is and see right through the media's attempt to repackage old garbage to push their own biased narrative. Take a look at this. What do you see?

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: I think this is from 1990. Isn't there a way to make this new and fresh again?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There is. Thanks to Throwitbax.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Throwitbax trick your brain into thinking decades old Monday news items are a modern day scandal by erasing all of your long term memory. So you'll be blown away even by the most stale reporting.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: How does it do that?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I already told you by erasing all of your long term memory.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Wait a minute, I already took it. Who are you anyway?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I'm the announcer. We've been doing the same thing for three years.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Really?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, we do an ad about a drug for almost every monologue. Geez. This stuff really works.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Wow. This is on believable. Did you know Trump has been married three times? Also it says here he loves to golf. He is never going to be elected.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He was elected in 2016.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: I must have missed that. And look at this, it says the whole city is getting indoor plumbing. Now, where's all the water going to come from? And how about this? Women expected to get the right to vote? I don't like that at all.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You're an idiot. I'm leaving you.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Who are you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm your wife.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.sentences: Someone married me. That's awesome. Thanks, product whose name I forget.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: So get Throwitbax today, making everything old brand new again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The point is, the media drenched in its own failure has to reanimate old fears. Remember that story from months ago about Trump never leaving office? Well, it's back.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He doesn't have any intention of committing to a peaceful transition of power. How would you get a President to leave if he just said, "I ain't leaving?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, wasn't it Joy who wouldn't leave following some bad stuff revealed about her past? If only the media could find two words they could repeat over and over again.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Folks, a constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: ERIN BURNETT, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: A constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Do you agree with Congressman Nadler - Chairman Nadler that we're in a constitutional crisis?

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: We are.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Ever wonder what a constitutional crisis looks like? Well, open your eyes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, it looks like Don Lemon. Anyway. So what is the crisis really? That they're out of ideas, that they all share the same script, that they're all sheep without the benefits of supplying plush wool sweaters? You think it bothers Trump? Nah, he's got bigger concerns.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I have to tell you that runway is like an ice skating rink. And the first step I said, you know, this sucker is slippery. I think it was put in by the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who knows?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He gets the biggest clap. I don't even have to write this stuff. It does feel like a trap.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I don't know whoever the hell got that thing? That's not -- that's a trap. I'm telling you. It's like -- it's like ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can you imagine if he went down?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Can you imagine if I went down? The press would have a field day for weeks and weeks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, it's like he's floating around on a piece of ice.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: As I stand here floating around on a piece of ice, this is crazy. I'm a little bit concerned about leaving the podium. I'm holding. You have no idea what I'm going through this stage. This is the worst damn stage I've ever seen.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I've never seen anything --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I wonder who did this one.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Stupid people did this one.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: No, no. Or brilliant. Or brilliant. They may be the enemy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So what kind of President talks about the slippery stage? That guy? The complete opposite of a politician. There's no phony cadence, no regurgitated platitudes. Just his thoughts on slippery floors. So now the media and the Democrats accuse Trump of the very worst. So what's the next stop on this crazy train? Let's review. First stop was Trump is unstable; the second stop, he is insane. The third stop, he is a Russian spy who stole the election. The fourth stop, he won't leave office. The fifth stop, he created a constitutional crisis. So what's next? Could Trump be an ISIS?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And Maroon 5.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If the media wants you to think there's an unstable tyrant, barricading himself in the Oval Office, then who is trying to create the crisis really? And to what end? What do they want to happen? It's sad they're still trying to undo 2016 instead of trying to win 2020? It's the losers' response to losing. Winners admit they're wrong and they change, but not here. Instead, they just dig a deeper grave as they reelect the person who keeps handing them the shovels.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.sentences: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Let's welcome tonight's guests. She has got a fixation on litigation, attorney and Fox News contributor, Emily Compagno.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is like a sloppy, less handsome Jonas brother, writer and comedian, Kris Fried. Fried.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kris Fried. Damn it. She is the scamp who likes the vamp. Host of the "Tyrus and Timpf Podcast," Katherine Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And he flosses with the transatlantic cable, former WWE superstar and my massive sidekick, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Okay, Emily, thoughts? Constitutional crisis?

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Absolutely not. I feel like everyone -- all of these Federal elected officials are totally obsessed with just taking down Trump. So they're not legislating they're not doing their job. They're not doing anything that we pay them to do. And while they keep wasting time doing that, like you said, 2020 is coming closer and closer, they will have nothing to show for it.  And now they're literally talking about codifying, putting into Federal law, essentially things that will help get Trump afterwards because they're never going to let it go. And while they are mired in that, our state legislators have been busy also writing bills to make sure that they can get Trump afterward, and all it's doing is going to affect us, as private citizens.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So is codifying like when you take a fish --

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: You know what it means. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FOX NATION HOST: It's like extra hugs for a baby? Coddling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm confused, Kris.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's not a codfish, you ugly codfish. Peter Pan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was cruel.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS FRIED, COMEDIAN
utterances.sentences: I know that word as well as you know, my last name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Fried. Now everybody knows it.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: He is his best friend that totally knows who he is. Kris Fried.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thoughts? Anything interesting about the show in general? Or you just want to talk about your name?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: I like to talk about me some more. What I find interesting is that the media still uses the word shocking when it's a Stormy Daniels story. And I don't like it. Number one, because most things like if you get a pop up, Stormy Daniels with a shocked face, chances are what she's looking at gives you a virus of some kind so you can't click on it. I don't like that. Number one. Number two, it is just not shocking. Like it wasn't shocking that Trump slept with her either. The whole thing was never shocking. It's stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, a billionaire in New York City who has had lots of flings sleeping with a porn star. I think that's required. I don't know, Kat? Not a question really, but just to --

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't really know where you want me to go with that, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Are you happy she's doing standup?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I feel like it's fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's good.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: You know, I feel like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You go, girl. I liked it. I coined that phrase.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Yes, I feel like it's fine. I feel like it's better than doing porn to do standup. It's a little more difficult. So best of luck. There is nothing worse than being on stage and trying to tell jokes and having nobody laugh. It's really, really quite sad. But, you know, I wish her the best. I wish her the best. I really, really do. And it's funny that her lawyer, Avenatti, obviously, he is worse than Trump. What are they even talking about? He stole money from people who were paraplegic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Trump lost $2 billion. I lost my cat in my apartment once. Sometimes you lose stuff. But all that matters is that you come out on top.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: I found the cat. He has a career, as is well that ends well. Over and out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Over and out. Tyrus, last word to you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I keep having this thought in my head I want to say about Stormy doing standup, but I know I'm going to get in trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Believe me, I edited that monologue three times.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: You know when the adult films is not working, they have a particular person with the job title who comes in and makes it work. Comedy is tough. It's tough. And maybe the audience, maybe you can help me. The word "constitutional crisis." They say it a lot. But no one asked, how so? Like, Don Lemon, if I was a guest on his show, which I wouldn't be, but if I was I'd be like, "What does it mean?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Well, open your eyes. Okay, they're open. What is it? It's there in plain sight. I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Is the constitution stressed out? Like what is? What is the crisis? They use the term with no definition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a constitutional crisis every day.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No, I don't want to talk it. That's what I am saying, man. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you get older, it's just a reality.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: No one has explained it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. No one --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Constitutional crisis. How so?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Mine is whenever I have cheese.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: I am not biting on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am lactose intolerant. What?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: Our founding fathers would be ashamed at your language, Mr. Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, because they don't know what constitutional crisis is either. Their constitutional crisis was England showing up saying we're taking it back. That's a constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's so true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: So yes, I'd love to -- please, Don Lemon, if you get a second and no one is watching, so if you get a second.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We've got a lot more to come. Trump gives his opinion and all the candidates. We listen and comment that's how it works.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is bringing the funny to 2020. Yes, it's barely May and Trump is already in full campaign mode. That means picking off challengers one by one.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We've got some real beauties. Crazy Bernie. We have a choice between Sleepy Joe and Crazy Bernie. And I'll take any of them. Let's just pick somebody please, and let's start this thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He is right. Let's start this thing. I agree. Why even pretend they all have a chance. Remember when Beto was supposed to be next in line? I mean Beto, Beto, boy has he fallen like a rock?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Beto, Beto. Boy, has he fallen like a rock. What the hell happened to Beto?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, sorry. Yes, Beto was here a second ago. I guess when the media gets bored with you, you're gone. And what of Mayor Pete? His last name is fun to say.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We have a man, Buttigieg, Buttigieg. They say edge, edge. He has got a great chance. He'll be great. He will be great representing us against President Xi of China. That'll be great. That'll be great. I want to be in that room. I want to watch that one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is going to be fun. But Trump is right, they should just start this thing because only a handful of the 21 hopefuls have sustained any attention. According to a study from Politico, from January to April 30, the media focused on just four Dems, Sanders Biden, Harris and Warren, who took up more than half the field's coverage. In other words, fringe candidate Seth Kansas has no chance. Right, Seth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That worked out well. Kris, I do believe that this could be the greatest election ever because Trump is going to be there doing commentary.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: This is the Endgame to the first Infinity War. They're getting ready to battle that, you know, Trump Thanos thing. What I find fun is that the whole thing -- it doesn't matter really, because the entertainment is coming from Trump. So he's just going to treat it as a reality show where every week you know, next year there's going to be a new one eliminated. And it's just him as the only judge. And everyone --

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: They are just, you know, the whole thing is just going to be and let's go to Twitter to see what Trump says is why they lost, you know. It's going to be great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is truly "The Apprentice." I was thinking, Tyrus of like, that they're like the NPCs in a political video game and he is playing the video game.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, here's the thing. Whoever wins is trashed. Like, it's literally "The Biggest Loser," but we'll keep it a reality TV show. They're going to go through hell with him on the sidelines making fun of them, heckling the entire time. I wouldn't be surprised if he showed up and got a higher podium at one of their debates.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: And he'll go, "You're blowing it, Biden." You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a good question.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: They can't stop him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like let's say he wants to be like those little guys in the Muppets, the old guys.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The two judges? Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.sentences: Statler and Waldorf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what? That was a test to see if Kris knew because that's sad. But anyway, could the President demand to be there?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: If he is, I will be the other guy. One hundred percent, we'll sit there and eat popcorn and go, "ha-ha-ha" the whole time. It will be great. But what I'm saying is, like he is going to do his comedy bit the entire time to literally make a joke out whoever comes out and when they come out, going back to the horse you had on, it will be a horse that has been in a stable so long. Even when you open the doors, David Attenborough, even with freedom they won't come out, which is just --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: It's that bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kat, what can the Dems do? Is there anything that they can do? Kat, can they find their Trump?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: They can't. I don't know why anyone would ever want to run against President Trump. I cannot even read my Instagram comments without feeling bad about myself. Like, I just don't think I have the self-esteem for it. And I don't know how anyone does because he is so good at insulting people, to the point where it just shuts them down. Like for example, Elizabeth Warren could spend so much time and effort. She's a policy wonk, talking about this plan, and she explained it really well. And it could sound great, and then Trump just has to go, "Whatever, Pocahontas," and he wins.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.sentences: There's nothing you can say to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's true. That's true. I bet he has a nickname for everybody, Emily.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Oh, I'm sure. Probably all of us, too. I feel like exactly what you were saying where it's probably like Best in Show turns into "Hunger Games." Because whoever wins that primary, I mean, have fun in gladiator arena.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. But you know what, that -- we haven't seen the person yet. That's what I'm thinking. I'm thinking that the Dems to beat Trump have to have their own Trump and it's not them. It's not -- even the strong candidates like Kamala, I don't think she can go up against it. It has to be somebody who steps outside the political duopoly The Republicans versus the Democrats. That's what Trump did. He stepped out of that and that's why they couldn't figure him out.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.sentences: Well, his gravity is so strong, I feel like that that person would have to not -- would have to be outside of his orbit and not have everything and that's just a response to what he does.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's like a giant planet and they're like little satellites.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The person would have to not be a politician.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Because politicians --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oprah.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, remember we said Oprah two years ago then Bill Maher said it, but we said it two years ago.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: The politicians are going to try to be a politician. He is going to make fun of them and they're going to be like, "Well, I mean, if I go back to policy," and Americans are going to be like, "Are you kidding me?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I want to hear more about the slippery floors.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.sentences: This guy is talking policy and it's a roast, like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, we've got more and more and more and more and more. Coming up, a grown man picks on old ladies and children and surprise, it backfires.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. Three people are dead after a gas station explosion in Virginia. Four others were injured in that blast in Rockbridge County. Investigators say this has been treated as a criminal matter, but they also say it doesn't look like it is suspicious. Disturbing new developments tonight in the search for a missing four-year- old girl in Houston. Police say they found bloody evidence in the home of her mother's ex-fiance linked to Maleah Davis. Her stepfather claims she was kidnapped by three men. Darion Vence says that they ambushed him and knocked him unconscious, and when he woke up Maleah was missing, but her two-year-old brother was still there. Today Vence was charged with tampering with evidence. Maleah has several health issues. She's had multiple brain surgeries. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.” For all your headlines, log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Could he be out of work for being a jerk? Democratic Pennsylvania State Representative -- aren't they all -- Brian Sims took a video of himself berating a pro-life woman outside a Planned Parenthood in Philly. Watching cringe, watching cringers.

utterances.speaker: REP. BRIAN SIMS, D-PENN.
utterances.sentences: I'm once again out in front of Planned Parenthood of Southeastern Pennsylvania. Today's protester, now she is an old white lady who is going to try to avoid showing you her face. An old white lady telling people what's right to do with their bodies. Shame on you. Shame, shame, shame. Everyone, this is what they deserve. This is what they need.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.utterance: Yes, we do an ad about a drug for almost every monologue. Geez. This stuff really works.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Wow. This is on believable. Did you know Trump has been married three times? Also it says here he loves to golf. He is never going to be elected.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: He was elected in 2016.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: I must have missed that. And look at this, it says the whole city is getting indoor plumbing. Now, where's all the water going to come from? And how about this? Women expected to get the right to vote? I don't like that at all.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You're an idiot. I'm leaving you.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Who are you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I'm your wife.

utterances.speaker: SHILLUE
utterances.utterance: Someone married me. That's awesome. Thanks, product whose name I forget.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: So get Throwitbax today, making everything old brand new again.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The point is, the media drenched in its own failure has to reanimate old fears. Remember that story from months ago about Trump never leaving office? Well, it's back.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: He doesn't have any intention of committing to a peaceful transition of power. How would you get a President to leave if he just said, "I ain't leaving?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, wasn't it Joy who wouldn't leave following some bad stuff revealed about her past? If only the media could find two words they could repeat over and over again.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Folks, a constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: ERIN BURNETT, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: A constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Do you agree with Congressman Nadler - Chairman Nadler that we're in a constitutional crisis?

utterances.speaker: REP. ADAM SCHIFF, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: We are.

utterances.speaker: DON LEMON, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: Ever wonder what a constitutional crisis looks like? Well, open your eyes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it looks like Don Lemon. Anyway. So what is the crisis really? That they're out of ideas, that they all share the same script, that they're all sheep without the benefits of supplying plush wool sweaters? You think it bothers Trump? Nah, he's got bigger concerns.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I have to tell you that runway is like an ice skating rink. And the first step I said, you know, this sucker is slippery. I think it was put in by the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who knows?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He gets the biggest clap. I don't even have to write this stuff. It does feel like a trap.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I don't know whoever the hell got that thing? That's not -- that's a trap. I'm telling you. It's like -- it's like ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can you imagine if he went down?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Can you imagine if I went down? The press would have a field day for weeks and weeks.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, it's like he's floating around on a piece of ice.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: As I stand here floating around on a piece of ice, this is crazy. I'm a little bit concerned about leaving the podium. I'm holding. You have no idea what I'm going through this stage. This is the worst damn stage I've ever seen.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: I've never seen anything --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I wonder who did this one.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Stupid people did this one.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: No, no. Or brilliant. Or brilliant. They may be the enemy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So what kind of President talks about the slippery stage? That guy? The complete opposite of a politician. There's no phony cadence, no regurgitated platitudes. Just his thoughts on slippery floors. So now the media and the Democrats accuse Trump of the very worst. So what's the next stop on this crazy train? Let's review. First stop was Trump is unstable; the second stop, he is insane. The third stop, he is a Russian spy who stole the election. The fourth stop, he won't leave office. The fifth stop, he created a constitutional crisis. So what's next? Could Trump be an ISIS?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And Maroon 5.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If the media wants you to think there's an unstable tyrant, barricading himself in the Oval Office, then who is trying to create the crisis really? And to what end? What do they want to happen? It's sad they're still trying to undo 2016 instead of trying to win 2020? It's the losers' response to losing. Winners admit they're wrong and they change, but not here. Instead, they just dig a deeper grave as they reelect the person who keeps handing them the shovels.

utterances.speaker: ANNOUNCER
utterances.utterance: Period.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's welcome tonight's guests. She has got a fixation on litigation, attorney and Fox News contributor, Emily Compagno.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is like a sloppy, less handsome Jonas brother, writer and comedian, Kris Fried. Fried.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kris Fried. Damn it. She is the scamp who likes the vamp. Host of the "Tyrus and Timpf Podcast," Katherine Timpf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And he flosses with the transatlantic cable, former WWE superstar and my massive sidekick, Tyrus.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Okay, Emily, thoughts? Constitutional crisis?

utterances.speaker: EMILY COMPAGNO, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Absolutely not. I feel like everyone -- all of these Federal elected officials are totally obsessed with just taking down Trump. So they're not legislating they're not doing their job. They're not doing anything that we pay them to do. And while they keep wasting time doing that, like you said, 2020 is coming closer and closer, they will have nothing to show for it. And now they're literally talking about codifying, putting into Federal law, essentially things that will help get Trump afterwards because they're never going to let it go. And while they are mired in that, our state legislators have been busy also writing bills to make sure that they can get Trump afterward, and all it's doing is going to affect us, as private citizens.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So is codifying like when you take a fish --

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: You know what it means. GEORGE "TYRUS" MURDOCH, FOX NATION HOST: It's like extra hugs for a baby? Coddling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm confused, Kris.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's not a codfish, you ugly codfish. Peter Pan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was cruel.

utterances.speaker: CHRIS FRIED, COMEDIAN
utterances.utterance: I know that word as well as you know, my last name.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Fried. Now everybody knows it.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: He is his best friend that totally knows who he is. Kris Fried.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thoughts? Anything interesting about the show in general? Or you just want to talk about your name?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: I like to talk about me some more. What I find interesting is that the media still uses the word shocking when it's a Stormy Daniels story. And I don't like it. Number one, because most things like if you get a pop up, Stormy Daniels with a shocked face, chances are what she's looking at gives you a virus of some kind so you can't click on it. I don't like that. Number one. Number two, it is just not shocking. Like it wasn't shocking that Trump slept with her either. The whole thing was never shocking. It's stupid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, a billionaire in New York City who has had lots of flings sleeping with a porn star. I think that's required. I don't know, Kat? Not a question really, but just to --

utterances.speaker: KATHERINE TIMPF, CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes, I don't really know where you want me to go with that, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Are you happy she's doing standup?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I feel like it's fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's good.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: You know, I feel like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You go, girl. I liked it. I coined that phrase.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, I feel like it's fine. I feel like it's better than doing porn to do standup. It's a little more difficult. So best of luck. There is nothing worse than being on stage and trying to tell jokes and having nobody laugh. It's really, really quite sad. But, you know, I wish her the best. I wish her the best. I really, really do. And it's funny that her lawyer, Avenatti, obviously, he is worse than Trump. What are they even talking about? He stole money from people who were paraplegic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Trump lost $2 billion. I lost my cat in my apartment once. Sometimes you lose stuff. But all that matters is that you come out on top.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I found the cat. He has a career, as is well that ends well. Over and out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Over and out. Tyrus, last word to you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I keep having this thought in my head I want to say about Stormy doing standup, but I know I'm going to get in trouble.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Believe me, I edited that monologue three times.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know when the adult films is not working, they have a particular person with the job title who comes in and makes it work. Comedy is tough. It's tough. And maybe the audience, maybe you can help me. The word "constitutional crisis." They say it a lot. But no one asked, how so? Like, Don Lemon, if I was a guest on his show, which I wouldn't be, but if I was I'd be like, "What does it mean?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Well, open your eyes. Okay, they're open. What is it? It's there in plain sight. I don't know what it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Is the constitution stressed out? Like what is? What is the crisis? They use the term with no definition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I have a constitutional crisis every day.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, I don't want to talk it. That's what I am saying, man. No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you get older, it's just a reality.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No one has explained it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. No one --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Constitutional crisis. How so?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Mine is whenever I have cheese.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I am not biting on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am lactose intolerant. What?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Our founding fathers would be ashamed at your language, Mr. Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, because they don't know what constitutional crisis is either. Their constitutional crisis was England showing up saying we're taking it back. That's a constitutional crisis.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's so true.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: So yes, I'd love to -- please, Don Lemon, if you get a second and no one is watching, so if you get a second.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've got a lot more to come. Trump gives his opinion and all the candidates. We listen and comment that's how it works.

utterances.utterance: He is bringing the funny to 2020. Yes, it's barely May and Trump is already in full campaign mode. That means picking off challengers one by one.

utterances.utterance: We've got some real beauties. Crazy Bernie. We have a choice between Sleepy Joe and Crazy Bernie. And I'll take any of them. Let's just pick somebody please, and let's start this thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He is right. Let's start this thing. I agree. Why even pretend they all have a chance. Remember when Beto was supposed to be next in line? I mean Beto, Beto, boy has he fallen like a rock?

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Beto, Beto. Boy, has he fallen like a rock. What the hell happened to Beto?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, sorry. Yes, Beto was here a second ago. I guess when the media gets bored with you, you're gone. And what of Mayor Pete? His last name is fun to say.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We have a man, Buttigieg, Buttigieg. They say edge, edge. He has got a great chance. He'll be great. He will be great representing us against President Xi of China. That'll be great. That'll be great. I want to be in that room. I want to watch that one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is going to be fun. But Trump is right, they should just start this thing because only a handful of the 21 hopefuls have sustained any attention. According to a study from Politico, from January to April 30, the media focused on just four Dems, Sanders Biden, Harris and Warren, who took up more than half the field's coverage. In other words, fringe candidate Seth Kansas has no chance. Right, Seth?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That worked out well. Kris, I do believe that this could be the greatest election ever because Trump is going to be there doing commentary.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: This is the Endgame to the first Infinity War. They're getting ready to battle that, you know, Trump Thanos thing. What I find fun is that the whole thing -- it doesn't matter really, because the entertainment is coming from Trump. So he's just going to treat it as a reality show where every week you know, next year there's going to be a new one eliminated. And it's just him as the only judge. And everyone --

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: They are just, you know, the whole thing is just going to be and let's go to Twitter to see what Trump says is why they lost, you know. It's going to be great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is truly "The Apprentice." I was thinking, Tyrus of like, that they're like the NPCs in a political video game and he is playing the video game.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes, I mean, here's the thing. Whoever wins is trashed. Like, it's literally "The Biggest Loser," but we'll keep it a reality TV show. They're going to go through hell with him on the sidelines making fun of them, heckling the entire time. I wouldn't be surprised if he showed up and got a higher podium at one of their debates.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And he'll go, "You're blowing it, Biden." You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a good question.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: They can't stop him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like let's say he wants to be like those little guys in the Muppets, the old guys.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: The two judges? Yes.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: Statler and Waldorf.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what? That was a test to see if Kris knew because that's sad. But anyway, could the President demand to be there?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: If he is, I will be the other guy. One hundred percent, we'll sit there and eat popcorn and go, "ha-ha-ha" the whole time. It will be great. But what I'm saying is, like he is going to do his comedy bit the entire time to literally make a joke out whoever comes out and when they come out, going back to the horse you had on, it will be a horse that has been in a stable so long. Even when you open the doors, David Attenborough, even with freedom they won't come out, which is just --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's that bad.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, what can the Dems do? Is there anything that they can do? Kat, can they find their Trump?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: They can't. I don't know why anyone would ever want to run against President Trump. I cannot even read my Instagram comments without feeling bad about myself. Like, I just don't think I have the self-esteem for it. And I don't know how anyone does because he is so good at insulting people, to the point where it just shuts them down. Like for example, Elizabeth Warren could spend so much time and effort. She's a policy wonk, talking about this plan, and she explained it really well. And it could sound great, and then Trump just has to go, "Whatever, Pocahontas," and he wins.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: There's nothing you can say to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true. That's true. I bet he has a nickname for everybody, Emily.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm sure. Probably all of us, too. I feel like exactly what you were saying where it's probably like Best in Show turns into "Hunger Games." Because whoever wins that primary, I mean, have fun in gladiator arena.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. But you know what, that -- we haven't seen the person yet. That's what I'm thinking. I'm thinking that the Dems to beat Trump have to have their own Trump and it's not them. It's not -- even the strong candidates like Kamala, I don't think she can go up against it. It has to be somebody who steps outside the political duopoly The Republicans versus the Democrats. That's what Trump did. He stepped out of that and that's why they couldn't figure him out.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Well, his gravity is so strong, I feel like that that person would have to not -- would have to be outside of his orbit and not have everything and that's just a response to what he does.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, he's like a giant planet and they're like little satellites.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: The person would have to not be a politician.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Because politicians --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oprah.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, remember we said Oprah two years ago then Bill Maher said it, but we said it two years ago.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: The politicians are going to try to be a politician. He is going to make fun of them and they're going to be like, "Well, I mean, if I go back to policy," and Americans are going to be like, "Are you kidding me?"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I want to hear more about the slippery floors.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: This guy is talking policy and it's a roast, like --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, we've got more and more and more and more and more. Coming up, a grown man picks on old ladies and children and surprise, it backfires.

utterances.speaker: AISHAH HASNIE, CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Live from "America's News Headquarters," I'm Aishah Hasnie. Three people are dead after a gas station explosion in Virginia. Four others were injured in that blast in Rockbridge County. Investigators say this has been treated as a criminal matter, but they also say it doesn't look like it is suspicious. Disturbing new developments tonight in the search for a missing four-year- old girl in Houston. Police say they found bloody evidence in the home of her mother's ex-fiance linked to Maleah Davis. Her stepfather claims she was kidnapped by three men. Darion Vence says that they ambushed him and knocked him unconscious, and when he woke up Maleah was missing, but her two-year-old brother was still there. Today Vence was charged with tampering with evidence. Maleah has several health issues. She's had multiple brain surgeries. I'm Aishah Hasnie, now back to “The Greg Gutfeld Show.” For all your headlines, log on to foxnews.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Could he be out of work for being a jerk? Democratic Pennsylvania State Representative -- aren't they all -- Brian Sims took a video of himself berating a pro-life woman outside a Planned Parenthood in Philly. Watching cringe, watching cringers.

utterances.utterance: I'm once again out in front of Planned Parenthood of Southeastern Pennsylvania. Today's protester, now she is an old white lady who is going to try to avoid showing you her face. An old white lady telling people what's right to do with their bodies. Shame on you. Shame, shame, shame. Everyone, this is what they deserve. This is what they need.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He seems like a total catch. By the way that went on for eight minutes. And it's not his first offense. Just weeks ago, he approached a woman and three young girls outside the same place. It offered to reward anyone who would docs or identify them.

utterances.speaker: SIMS
utterances.utterance: What we've got here is a bunch of protesters -- a bunch of pseudo Kristian protesters who've been out here shaming young girls for being here. So here's the deal. I've got $100.00 for anybody who will identify any of these three.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So we're actually here just praying for the babies and we believe that women deserves more.

utterances.speaker: SIMS
utterances.utterance: I'm going to donate to Planned Parenthood. So look, a bunch of white people standing up in front of a Planned Parenthood.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Women deserve more.

utterances.speaker: SIMS
utterances.utterance: Shaming people. There's nothing Kristian about what you're doing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Some of them weren't white by the way. Following those videos, the state's GOP Chair called for an investigation to whether Sims violated any harassment laws. Meanwhile, Sims vowed to do better.

utterances.speaker: SIMS
utterances.utterance: As an activist and an advocate, I know why pushing back against harassment and discrimination are a must, even when they're uncomfortable. But last week, I wasn't a patient escort. I was a neighbor and a concerned citizen and I was aggressive. I know that two wrongs don't make a right and I can do better and I will do better for the women of Pennsylvania.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Bleh. Look, bottom line being a jerk is never a good way to disperse a crowd. You've got to think outside the box. You know what I do? I use a cucumber for my cats, Bartles and Jaymes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right pee, Bartles. Tyrus, I always wonder, do you think that if you were out there, if you were actually one of the protesters, do you see him doing that to you? I mean, it's women, a little old lady.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I am pretty sure when it was over, he'd been praying with me.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He would have been handing out pamphlets, because these pamphlets are too small, the letters need to be bigger. I know, bro. If you're going to do something -- first of all, I wouldn't really call that a protest. It was a small group of people. They were praying. Obviously, that's their right, but if you're going to do that, get a camera crew or try take two or three. Huh, so I'm here at this thing and we're going to go to this people. Like $100.00 for somebody's name. A $100.00? That's your budget. Like that was I couldn't even get to whatever his message was because of the heavy breathing, too close to your face. Like get a director and a cameraman.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have a production criticism.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I have because it was so bad. And it might not have looked as bad as it looked when he was like, this little old woman is literally quietly praying, while he stands with his phone running around her. Get a camera crew, at least -- and have a script.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Emily, I don't trust anybody that walks around going "Shame on you. Shame on you." They're never -- they're always really weird, crazy people.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Totally, I mean that -- it's just -- and even hearing his apology after, I felt like he just looked up all the cool woke words to use. And then said it all.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He did.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: And what's so disturbing to me too, is you know, these people feel religiously and ideologically very convicted about this. So when he is like, "I'm going to go film this and put them on blast." Like aren't there a lot of other actual injustices out there that you can be recording that might help law enforcement or might help communities in need. And instead he's trying to shame people for feeling convicted about something and life at it. Like there's an -- it makes no sense to me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what it was, Kat, because it was about him.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He thought that this was going to make him -- like he's just -- he's not a real congressman. He's a state congressman. So he was trying to enlarge his media spotlight. He knew what he was doing. He practiced - - you know, he practices in the mirror, right? He's just going oh, this is going to be great. I'm going to be the love of Media Matters.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: That's why you need a director.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes. I don't know a lot about being a politician. But the way I've understood it, is that it's important for you to be likable. And I've always thought that when you're trying to be likable, berating teenage girls for praying is on the list of things not to do. Like what's he going to do next? Like go to a soup kitchen and call the volunteers jerks?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Like, go to an orphanage and call all the kids fat. I mean, is that what he is going to do next? It's ridiculous. He thought that he was just going to be popular and likeable by doing this. But he just came off looking like a total jerk.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I would. I agree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would not suggest fat shaming orphans anywhere.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's bad, Kris.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think it's bad.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Body positivity for orphans and everyone else.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Last word, Kris. What did you make of his --

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: It took me a while to get into it because at first I thought it was Dustin Diamond "Screech" from "Saved by the Bell" like, he got like a counselor jobs because he tries to be like that cool hip with the student. You know, he is like, "Oh, I'm a politician, but I have this modern beard. Look at me." I don't know. The whole thing -- and then, so he put out like an apology.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you're kind of bitter about the beard.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: I am. I am.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you can do a better job. Just let it grow out a little bit more.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, you know, right now, it doesn't look that great. That's okay.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: I know. I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's all right. Anyway. I like how they just showed you beard just now. He's got a great beard. No more beard shaming. Oh, you're going to love this next segment. I'm so excited. Are robot cops the future of Highway Patrol? I hope not. It takes out all the fun of being frisked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Would you pull over and stop for a robot cop? SRI International -- whoever they are -- has developed a police robot prototype to prevent dangerous interactions during traffic stops which is great. First, a robo- arm extends from the cop car to the car in front of it and spits out a spike strip behind the rear tires. It's great. While this happened, it comes with really neat music. Anyway, it's maybe a little slow, but it's just a prototype. Then an officer talks to the driver via a webcam without ever leaving the car.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Good afternoon, ma'am. Do you know why I pulled you over?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You were speeding in a school zone. Can I please see your license and registration?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, man, if I have one of these, I'd definitely pull over Doocey and Kilmeade on the way to work. Because they carpool together on a Vespa. At this point, the thing will scan a license and spit out a ticket.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Please hold that up to the small blinking scanner. I'm going to start withdrawing the arm. Please do not drive away until I give you an explicit okay to do so. All right, Ms. Brewer, you have a good afternoon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Thank you, sir.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's nice. That's very nice. It's like a modern day Colombo. But who am I to talk? Here's the last thing I invented.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's got two uses. What? It chews gum and chews other gum.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Sorry, kids.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Kat, people who are mocking this, this is my theory. Fiction has tricked people into thinking that robots look like you know robots from movies. But robots are basically like washers and dryers in the sense that they freed individuals from mundane activities. And in this case, this would free the police from getting shot at.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Right. And I am anti-people getting shot at.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I'll back you up on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No applause.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: No applause for that.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I thought that that was a shoo-in. No, I mean, I do like though, that you still are communicating with an actual officer. Because if it was just a robot, you would have no help -- no hope of ever manipulating your way out of a ticket again, which would be good for other people, but bad for me, which is how I view everything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. Exactly. Yes. Whenever I get pulled over I always unbutton to the top button, Kris, and it usually works.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: How does it work? They just see the top of your head.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I pro-robot, Kris, how about you?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: I like robot. Well, here's the thing, I'm disappointed with most things they call robots now. So you get excited because it's like -- you think it's this big breakthrough, and then it's a bit of a wizard behind the curtain kind of moment.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that's our fault.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: It is our fault. But you know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And your fault.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: We buy it, but then you know, it ends up being this you know, just lazier cup really that is creeping on this lady with a webcam. And you know, he got like a batting cage hat and put it on his son's iPad. Send it out there. I don't know, it's weird. My only question --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't think you could do better. But go with your question.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: I could not. My only -- my only question was that they said that the next one is going to have like it smells alcohol and stuff. Which is now weird, because the question is, where do you blow and will it look funny?

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You know, anything that reduce the risk of a confrontation, I'm for it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I've seen these similar things, and maybe some of you have when you go to rent a car. They now have the automated thing where you call the person. Those are always empty because no one likes using them. And then of course in the airports now you have the little you could talk to the computer instead of talking to the actual attendant. So I guess this is just the evolution of where we're going. I think for traffic stops, it is probably a good idea. My only concern would be if the robot jams. You're going to be there for a minute. You know, or hold on, I've got to load the paper. Just give me a second.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: And you're like, I'm late for work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We've got to call IT. IT comes out.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: IT comes out. You can't leave because there's spikes underneath the tire. So I'm always that guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's got to be an IT guy in the backseat of the cop car. He comes out.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Oh, wow, it's issuing you a warrant. No, I don't -- it's just -- there's seven tickets. Hold on. Hold on. Just give us a second.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You need the human touch. That's why they travel in packs. I mean in pairs, Emily.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: But it's a good thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They come out in packs. That would be strange, a live cop and a robot cop that way they can work together. And that allows for more pairs like you could double the police force.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Like CHIPS.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: There's definitely going to be a million lawsuits.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes, about this and also for each individual ticket and it reminded me when I saw that of just like, you know, how if you see a Prias with an arm, you're probably not you know, you're less like, oh, gosh, I have to pull over and it reminded me of this time in Nevada when a cop had pulled over someone else on the other side of the road. And so I was like, "ha-ha, of course he won't pull over me," like he's busy facing the other direction. And he pulled me over, too, and I got tickets for that. So this this Robocop will have the last say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was a great story. You know, this reminds me of how in the audience --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: Holding a cup of water.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, a cup of water. Throw the cup of water. Anybody remember "Homes in Yoyo"?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: God, I am old. That was a cop show where the human cop and robots. Come on. Look it up. People at home. And by the way, you're going to -- the only way this is going to work is they've got to teach the cop-bot how to do surveillance banter. Because if the police officer is stuck in a car with a robot, they've got to talk about sports and girls and stuff, because they're going spend hours. So it's like, "Hey, that girl in 'Game of Thrones' is hot." How about those Cubs. "The team not the offspring of bears." All right, I'm going to let that joke go away. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Banter. Robot banter. Coming up, my favorite story, a 71-year- old survives four months at sea in a homemade barrel. I just have one question. Is he single?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Rather than float in a boat, he faced peril in a barrel. A French adventurer -- are there any kind -- in his 70s recently completed a solo-transatlantic voyage in a handmade barrel. The journey which spanned the entire Atlantic Ocean began last December in the Canary Islands off the coast of Africa. That's a continent, Emily -- propelled entirely by the oceans current and eating nothing but the fish he caught himself. The man, Jean-Jacques Savin arrived last week on the shore of St. Eustatius Island in the Caribbean, where he was instantly executed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not really. When asked why he had spent four months in a barrel, he said, "Hey, I'm married."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: People never get their sea legs, right. Here's me on the last day of my diving school.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess, I didn't learn anything. All right, Kat, a hell of a hobby.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, doesn't he know there's plenty of good stuff on TV? You know, there's the entire internet. I just don't understand having that kind of faith that you're just going to float in a barrel and the ocean is going to bring you to where you want to go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I don't even have faith that my delivery guy is going to remember to scoop my bagel unless I text him and remind him and the consequences of that not going my way, I eat a little more bread than I wanted to. Things don't go his way, he dies. So I just don't understand having that kind of faith. I am glad it worked out for him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You scoop the bread?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, because then you know, it's better for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wow. Sorry. Yeah. Cut you off there.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: I'm used to it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, wow. You know, Tyrus, he crossed the Atlantic in a barrel. Weird. I once traveled across the Atlantic with a barrel inside me.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I don't care. I don't want to know. I thought you were going to ask me a cool scientific question about navigation and ocean currents, but you want to talk about something inside you and I don't want to do that. That's not -- What he did was -- it was cool. It was scientific. But when I first saw that barrel, I thought like barrel at Niagara Falls.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right, me too.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: I was thinking like, there was this big barrel and a guy with like a scarf trying to get across. But what he did, this is obviously a scientific experiment where he's using the winds and the currents and stuff like that, which is a cylinder shape is easy to travel. So this was a very clever, smart thing to do. And like I say, if you look at it that was not just your everyday barrel like that was designed specifically to do what he wanted to do. So you know, good for him, 71 years old, still out there doing the damn thing?

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: But, you're only saying it's smart, because he's not dead.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No, I am saying, it's not smart --

utterances.speaker: TIMPF
utterances.utterance: If he were dead, everyone would say, "What was he thinking?"

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: He knew the currents and how to sail. You know, I hate to be the one to tell you this, Kat, but the reason why most -- some of us not the way we wanted to -- but most of us got here because we hopped on a ship and used the winds and the currents to get here. Same premise.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a good point.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It's really not that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Emily, this is kind of the -- the kind of behavior that isn't really necessary. Like, this is what a robot would do. Right? We don't need to do this. Send the robots in a barrel, right?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Well, I feel like this is why he was living his dream. Like a robot -- like you said earlier, replaces the mundane tasks. But for him, this was just his like exploring. I just feel like the older I get, the more I'm aware of my own mortality. And so you know, when I was a kid, I was like, "Oh, I want to be an astronaut," and all this and now everyone who wants to fly to the moon and do everything, I'm like, "Absolutely not. I'll stay right here. Thank you."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, me too. I've got no interest in like floating --

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: You have no choice. You hear his name was Jean-Jacques. He had to do something.

utterances.speaker: MURDOCH
utterances.utterance: It wasn't like his name was Darrell.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right, I saved the best question for last, Kris, where the hell does the guy poop?

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: Well, that's the thing -- that was a question and then I had the same reaction as Tyrus, where I was thinking Niagara Falls like barrel fun, and then this guy's like, "Oh my god, I did this in a barrel." And you're like, "Oh, you mean that thing with the navigational systems and plumbing?" It's just -- he basically put would, he like nailed wood and plastic around my East Village apartment and threw it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is the size of your apartment.

utterances.speaker: FRIED
utterances.utterance: Yes, he spends four months basically living my life when I don't have shows coming up, and then you find yourself somehow in the Caribbean, you thank your parents. That's basically my life. So it can't be that hard.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that is how New Yorkers live with just a little bit of nausea, you know, to go with it. It's very sad. All right, well, that ended explosively. Don't go anywhere.
